headline: Here's Who Donald Trump Has Endorsed in Next Week's Primary Elections
author: Khaleda Rahman
sentences: Paxton, who has been under the cloud of an FBI investigation into claims he abused his office to benefit a wealthy donor and is also awaiting trial on state securities fraud charges, faces a run-off election against Texas Land Commissioner George P. Bush on May 24 after failing to reach the 50 percent threshold in a primary contest earlier this year.

And there have been some notable losses by Trump-backed candidatesincluding North Carolina Rep. Madison Cawthorn, who was ousted in a recent primary following a string of scandals despite Trump imploring voters to "give Madison a second chance!"

Here's who the former president has endorsed in Republican primary elections being held on May 24:
Alabama
GOP Rep. Mo Brooks won, then lost Trump's endorsement for the Senate seat being vacated by the retiring Sen. Richard Shelby.

He has also backed Vernon Jones in the crowded Republican primary to fill the seat being vacated by Hice in the state's 10th congressional district, and and Jake Evans in the state's 6th congressional district.
He has also backed the re-election bids of Sen. John Boozman and Rep. Rick Crawford, and endorsed Arkansas' lieutenant governor Tim Griffin for attorney general.
Kemp and Raffensperger both drew the former president's ire for failing to go along with his efforts to overturn the state's 2020 election result.
But as data compiled by Newsweek has shown, many of the candidates backed by the former president have been incumbents who rarely loses primaries.

Arkansas
Trump has endorsed his former press secretary, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, saying she would do "a fantastic job" as Arkansas' next governor.
Candidates Katie Boyd Britt and Mike Durant have courted Trump's endorsement, but he has yet to back another candidate in the Alabama race.
In the race for Secretary of State, Trump has backed Rep. Jody Hice, who is challenging Republican incumbent Brad Raffensperger.

Georgia
Trump is backing former Sen. David Perdue, who he recruited to enter Georgia's gubernatorial race in a bid to oust Gov.
Donald Trump has so far maintained a fairly impressive endorsement record in Republican primaries ahead of the 2022 midterms.
Trump has also endorsed former NFL star Herschel Walker who is seeking to unseat Raphael Warnock in the U.S Senate.

Texas
Trump has backed Ken Paxton in his bid for a third-term as Texas attorney general.
At the House level, Trump has endorsed Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene and Andrew Clyde.
Trump's clout will once again be tested in hotly contested upcoming primary contests.
